what_to_do.task: Set up and manage overtime policies and schedules for employees
steps: Navigate to Settings > Attendance > Overtime Policy
Click 'Add New' to create a new overtime policy
Enable or disable employee extra hours requests
Select hourly rate type: Single Rate or Custom Rate
Configure rate multipliers and select salary components
Define days calculation and working hours defaults
Assign specific employees to the policy
Schedule overtime by navigating to Attendance module > Time and Pay Adjustments
Choose compensation type (payroll or time off)
Employees receive overtime requests and can accept or reject them
View scheduled overtime hours as an employee via Attendance > Time & Pay Adjustments
Review extra hours details, manager's name, and comments
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Overtime policies are configured correctly, employees are assigned and scheduled for overtime, and employees can view and respond to overtime requests appropriately.

what_to_do.task: Configure hourly rate compensation for overtime
steps: Set up 'All Hours Worked' rule in Work Timings under Settings > Time
Configure Fixed Hourly Rate in Overtime Policy under Settings > Payroll
Review and approve time and pay adjustments in Employee Attendance
what_to_do.expected_outcome: Overtime compensation is calculated using a fixed hourly rate, with all hours worked classified as compensable, and payroll adjustments are reviewed and approved.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Complex and non-intuitive overtime calculation configurations
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The system lacks clear guidance on how break inclusion flags affect overtime calculations and how work week settings impact historical shift calculations, making it difficult for users to understand and predict overtime outcomes.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users must manually test different scenarios to understand break time effects and carefully manage work week and Days in Lieu policy settings to avoid unexpected retroactive changes.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Overtime reporting lacks critical employee identification data
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Employee IDs are not displayed in overtime reports, complicating data reconciliation for large workforces.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Use external reporting tools like Looker to supplement missing employee ID data.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Overtime pay configuration does not fully comply with UAE Federal labor law
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The platform lacks comprehensive overtime policy flexibility to meet specific UAE labor law requirements for different employee classifications and overtime rate calculations.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Manual adjustments outside the system may be required to ensure compliance.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Lack of customization in overtime calculation components
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: Users cannot selectively include or exclude specific allowance components in overtime calculations, leading to potential inaccuracies.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users must accept an all-inclusive calculation approach or manually adjust payroll outside the system.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Misleading or unclear overtime calculation formula display
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The formula's visual representation does not clearly communicate mathematical precedence, causing user confusion despite correct calculations.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Users should verify calculations through testing and not rely solely on the formula display.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Uncertainty about overtime policy effectiveness when assigned after shift publication
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: It is unclear how the system handles overtime policies added after shifts are published, causing potential confusion for administrators.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Administrators should verify policy effects through testing and communicate limitations to users.

what_to_watch_out_for.issue: Bulk approval of overtime by line managers is not easily discoverable
what_to_watch_out_for.limitation: The bulk approval feature exists but is not intuitive or well-known among line managers.
what_to_watch_out_for.workaround: Provide training or documentation to line managers about bulk approval functionality.
